lines.content: * The Bubbles program is the main implementation of the chatbot.
* It makes use of its UI, TaskList and Storage to properly handle and
* The UI represents the interactive portion of the chatbot to receive commands from user.
* Introduces chatbot and lists out tasks stored.
System.out.println("\tWhat can I do for you?\n" + LINE);
* Receives input from user and sends to TaskList to perform the operation.
* If input is bye, chatbot is stopped.
* Ends the chatbot with a parting message.
System.out.println(LINE + "\n\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!\n" + LINE);

public static LocalDateTime parseDate(String input) throws TaskException {

* A Storage object helps to store the tasks inputted by the user. The Storage object

* The Deadline class is a subclass of the Task class.
* The Deadline object contains a description, completion status and its due date.
* The Event class is a subclass of the Task class.
* The Event object has a description, completion status, start dateTime and end dateTime.
public Event(String taskName, LocalDateTime fromDateTime, LocalDateTime dueDateTime) {

* A TaskList object represents an ArrayList of tasks.
* This ArrayList is read from a Storage object.
* Performs an operation based on the input of the user.
* If command is list: List out all current Tasks.
* If command is mark: Mark the specified Task as completed.
* If command is unmark: Mark the specified Task as uncompleted.
* If command is delete: Delete the specified Task.
*     Otherwise, command must be an add operation. {@link #addTask(String, String)}
* @param message The input from the user.
* Adds a new Task and stores it in the Storage.
* If command is ToDo: Create new ToDo object.
* If command is Deadline: Create new Deadline object.
* If command is Event: Create new Event object.
* @throws TaskException if input is in wrong format or not recognised.
public void addTask(String command, String arg) throws TaskException {
